name: Cardamom Cinnamon Turmeric Iced Tea
description: Cardamom Cinnamon Turmeric Iced Tea. Spiced Iced tea like Thai Iced tea with turmeric coconut milk and Indian masala chai spices and ginger. Golden Milk Iced Tea. Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free Recipe
recipeIngredient: 1 to 2 tsp loose tea (depends on the tea brand and how strong you like the tea, or use tea bags)
1/4 tsp chai spice (or use a very generous pinch of cardamom and cinnamon and a dash of black pepper)
2 tbsp or more sugar (raw sugar, coconut sugar or other sweetener)
1 cup coconut milk ( or other non dairy milk)
1 tbsp sugar (raw or coconut or other sweetener)

recipeInstructions.text: Add all the tea ingredients to a saucepan and bring to a boil. Simmer for 2 minutes. Strain and set aside. Once cool, taste and adjust sweet and spice to preference. Chill until ready to serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Add all the tea ingredients to a saucepan and bring to a boil. Simmer for 2 minutes. Strain and set aside. Once cool, taste and adjust sweet and spice to preference. Chill until ready to serve.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the coconut milk with turmeric, cinnamon and sugar. You can also heat the milk to a boil to incorporate the turmeric and flavors better. Cool and chill until ready to serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the coconut milk with turmeric, cinnamon and sugar. You can also heat the milk to a boil to incorporate the turmeric and flavors better. Cool and chill until ready to serve.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill glasses with ice cubes in tall glasses (2 to 3 glasses depending on size).
recipeInstructions.name: Fill glasses with ice cubes in tall glasses (2 to 3 glasses depending on size).

recipeInstructions.text: Pour tea into the glasses to fill three quarters of the way.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour tea into the glasses to fill three quarters of the way.

recipeInstructions.text: Add some turmeric milk. Serve immediately. This tea also tastes amazing with just plain coconut milk.
